text:
For my application, I have redis queue class that wraps around rpush/lpop.
Is it possible to include in util.py?
title: Redis queue class based on rpush/lpop
clean_text: for applic I redi queue class wrap around rpushlpop Is possibl includ utilpi

title: Redis queue class based on rpush/lpop

text: `aioredis` is a general purpose Redis driver / connector, while queue is a specific purpose application. Queue is not what a driver needs to do its job, so I think it shouldn't be included in `aioredis`.
clean_text: gener purpos redi driver connector queue specif purpos applic queue driver need job I think shouldnt includ

text:
Perhaps you are right.
But I still think it is common use-case for Redis and wouldn't hurt to be included.
clean_text: perhap right but I still think common usecas redi wouldnt hurt includ

text:
Hi guys,
I agree with ushuz that such `Queue` should not be included in `aioredis`,
because its hard to satisfy everybodys needs: someone may want Queue based on lists
someone may want it based on sorted sets, someone may want it to be built with some other concept.

Anyway, you can publish you Queue implementation on pypi and give me a link to be included in docs.
I think it would be really helpful for lib users to see a list with such extensions.
clean_text: Hi guy I agre ushuz includ hard satisfi everybodi need someon may want queue base list someon may want base sort set someon may want built concept anyway publish queue implement pypi give link includ doc I think would realli help lib user see list extens

text: As for PR, it has some inconsistencies and may not work as expected, if you want I can comment what is wrong.
